intro: Caucalis latifolia var. megalocarpa, commonly known as the broadleaf caucalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
